clip.title: head tags
clip.feedback: No, the head tags provide descriptive information about the document that is not displayed in the body of the document.
Correct! The head tags provide descriptive information about the document that is not displayed in the body of the document.

clip.title: body tags
clip.feedback: No, the body tags contain the actual content of the Web page.
Correct! The body tags contain the actual content of the Web page.

clip.title: DTD
clip.feedback: No, the DTD references the document type definition.
Correct! The DTD references the document type definition.

clip.title: meta
clip.feedback: No, the meta element is an example of an empty element.
Correct! The meta element is an example of an empty element.

clip.title: W3C
clip.feedback: No, the W3C is the HTML standards-setting organization.
Correct! The W3C is the HTML standards-setting organization.

clip.title: title tags
clip.feedback: No, text typed between these tags displays in the browser's title bar.
Correct! The text contained within the title tag displays in the browser's title bar.

clip.title: XHTML
clip.feedback: No, XHTML is commonly thought of as the latest version of HTML.
Correct! XHTML is commonly thought of as the latest version of HTML.

clip.title: containers
clip.feedback: No, containers are elements with both opening and closing tags.
Correct! Containers are elements with both opening and closing tags.

clip.title: html tags
clip.feedback: No, html tags contain the entire document other than the !DOCTYPE declaration.
Correct! html tags contain the entire document other than the !DOCTYPE declaration.
